Weight Loss.name: Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 1 can (15 oz) chickpeas, drained and rinsed
recipe: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Weight Loss.name: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Peppers
recipe: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place bell pepper halves on a baking sheet.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in spinach, cook until wilted.
Add quinoa and feta cheese, mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Fill bell pepper halves with the mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until peppers are tender.
Serve hot.

Weight Loss.name: Zucchini Noodles with Pesto
recipe: In a food processor, combine basil, pine nuts, and garlic.
Slowly add olive oil while processing until smooth.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss zucchini noodles with pesto sauce.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese before serving.

Weight Loss.name: Cauliflower Rice
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in grated cauliflower, cook until tender.
Season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped cilantro before serving.

Weight Loss.name: Stuffed Portobello Mushrooms
recipe: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Brush mushrooms with olive oil and place on a baking sheet.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in spinach and cherry tomatoes, cook until spinach is wilted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Stuff mushrooms with the mixture.
Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese.
Bake for 20 minutes, until mushrooms are tender.
Serve hot.

Muscle Gain.name: Vegetarian Chili
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can kidney beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Add bell pepper and zucchini, cook until tender.
Stir in corn, black beans, kidney beans, and tomatoes.
Add chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

Muscle Gain.name: Vegetarian Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until fragrant.
Add bell peppers, zucchini, and broccoli, stir-fry until tender.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over rice or noodles.

Muscle Gain.name: Quinoa Salad
recipe: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Muscle Gain.name: Lentil Soup
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Add carrots and celery, cook until tender.
Stir in lentils, tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Add cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Serve hot.

Muscle Gain.name: Tofu Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add tofu, cook until golden brown on all sides.
Remove tofu from pan and set aside.
In the same pan, add onion and garlic, cook until fragrant.
Add bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli, stir-fry until tender.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Add tofu back to the pan, toss to coat.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot over rice or noodles.

Improve Stamina.name: Quinoa and Black Bean Salad
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: In a large bowl, combine quinoa, black beans, bell pepper, avocado, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lime juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat.
Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Improve Stamina.name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and diced
1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper.
Spread sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 25-30 minutes, until tender.
Warm tortillas in a dry skillet over medium heat.
Fill tortillas with sweet potatoes, black beans, red onion, cilantro, and avocado.
Serve hot.

Improve Stamina.name: Lentil and Veggie Stew
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Add carrots and celery, cook until tender.
Stir in lentils, tomatoes, and vegetable broth.
Add thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Serve hot.

Improve Stamina.name: Vegetable Stir-Fry
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until fragrant.
Add bell peppers, zucchini, and broccoli, stir-fry until tender.
Stir in soy sauce and sesame oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve over rice or noodles.

Improve Stamina.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1/2 cup black beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Place bell pepper halves on a baking sheet.
Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Stir in zucchini, quinoa, corn, black beans, and cilantro.
Season with salt and pepper.
Fill bell pepper halves with the mixture.
Bake for 25-30 minutes, until peppers are tender.
Serve hot.

Improve Flexibility.name: Mushroom and Spinach Pasta
recipe: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium heat.
Add onion and garlic, cook until softened.
Add mushrooms, cook until tender.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Drain pasta and add to the pan.
Toss to combine and heat through.
Season with salt, pepper, and Parmesan cheese.
Serve hot.

Improve Flexibility.name: Roasted Vegetable Bowl
recipe: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potato, bell pepper, zucchini, and broccoli with olive oil, cumin, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread vegetables on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender and slightly charred.
In a small bowl, whisk together tahini, lemon juice, and enough water to make a drizzling consistency.
Serve roasted vegetables drizzled with tahini sauce.
Serve hot.

Improve Flexibility.name: Caprese Salad
recipe: In a large bowl, combine cherry tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil.
Drizzle with balsamic vinegar and olive oil.
Season with salt and pepper.
Toss to combine.
Serve immediately.

Improve Flexibility.name: Spinach and Chickpea Curry
recipe: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion, garlic, and ginger, cook until softened.
Stir in cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper, cook until fragrant.
Add chickpeas, tomatoes, and coconut milk.
Simmer for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Stir in spinach and cook until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot over rice.

General Fitness.name: Quinoa Salad
recipe: Rinse quinoa under cold water.
In a medium pot, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add quinoa, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 15-20 minutes until water is absorbed and quinoa is tender.
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, cucumber, bell pepper, cherry tomatoes, red onion, and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.

General Fitness.name: Sweet Potato and Black Bean Tacos
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss sweet potatoes with olive oil, cumin, chili powder, paprika, salt, and pepper.
Spread sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and roast for 20-25 minutes, until tender.
In a small saucepan, heat black beans with a splash of water until warm.
Warm corn tortillas in a dry skillet or oven.
Assemble tacos with sweet potatoes, black beans, avocado, salsa, and cilantro.
Serve warm.

General Fitness.name: Greek Chickpea Salad
recipe: In a large bowl, combine chickpeas, cucumber, bell pepper, red onion, olives, and feta cheese.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, dill, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss to combine.
Serve chilled.

General Fitness.name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
recipe: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a large bowl, combine cooked quinoa, black beans, corn, salsa, cheese, cilantro, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Fill each bell pepper half with quinoa mixture.
Place stuffed peppers in a baking dish.
Cover with foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Remove foil and bake for an additional 10 minutes, until peppers are tender and filling is heated through.
Serve hot.

General Fitness.name: Avocado and Chickpea Wrap
recipe: In a bowl, combine mashed avocado, mashed chickpeas, red onion, cucumber, cilantro, lime juice, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Spread avocado-chickpea mixture evenly over tortillas.
Roll up tortillas tightly.
Slice wraps in half.
Serve chilled or at room temperature.

Improve Mental Health.name: Spinach and Mushroom Quiche
recipe: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a skillet, sauté spinach and mushrooms until tender.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, garlic powder, salt, and pepper.
Place pie crust in a pie dish.
Spread spinach, mushrooms, and feta cheese evenly over pie crust.
Pour egg mixture over spinach mixture.
Bake for 35-40 minutes, until quiche is set and golden brown.
Let cool slightly before serving.

Improve Mental Health.name: Blueberry Almond Smoothie Bowl
ingredients: Toppings: sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, granola
recipe: In a blender, combine frozen blueberries, banana, almond milk, Greek yogurt, almond butter, chia seeds, and honey.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Pour smoothie into a bowl.
Top with sliced almonds, fresh blueberries, and granola.
Serve immediately.

Boost Immunity.name: Turmeric Ginger Soup
recipe: In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add chopped onion and cook until translucent.
Add minced garlic, grated ginger, and ground turmeric. Cook for 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add vegetable broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15-20 minutes.
Stir in coconut milk and lemon juice.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot.

Boost Immunity.name: Citrus Immunity Smoothie
recipe: In a blender, combine orange segments, grapefruit segments, lemon segments, lime segments, spinach, Greek yogurt, honey, and water or coconut water.
Blend until smooth.
Add ice cubes and blend until desired consistency is reached.
Pour into glasses and serve immediately.
